title: Cleveland police announce arrest in November quintuple homicide
content:
CLEVELAND, Ohio - Cleveland police have made an arrest in the November 2014 quintuple homicide on the city's East Side.
Police Chief Calvin Williams and Deputy Chief Edward Tomba announced Wednesday afternoon that a man was arrested without incident earlier in the day. Few other details were given, including the man's name, age and role in the slayings at 1443 East 92nd Street that ended with five people dead and a 9-year-old girl wounded.
The suspect remains in custody and is expected to be charged within 48 hours, Tomba said.
"This is a first step," he said. "This is a good first step for us. It's a really good step for the community."
Tomba said investigators are still in the process of collecting evidence and executing search warrants. More suspects could be identified, he said.
A masked gunman opened fire at the East 92nd Street home on Nov. 21, killing Lemon Bryant, 60; Shaylona Williams, 17; Ja'rio Taylor, 18; and Sherita Johnson, 41.
Johnson, who was pregnant, was driven to the hospital where her child, Juwan, died after delivery.
Williams thanked the community and said dozens of tips had come in about the slayings.
Family of the victims could not immediately be reached for comment Wednesday afternoon.
